featured.text: More than 2,000 adults took part in the survey to find out about their knowledge of diet, healthcare, disease control, and medication.
Teens rated Hilfiger jeans as their number one brand in a survey in 2000.
In 1871 Moran joined the first US government survey of the Yellowstone region with photographer William Henry Jackson.
The results of this survey are not reliable because the people it questioned were not a typical or _____ sample of the entire population that was studied.
Surprisingly, only 51 percent of the people surveyed understand that the common cold has no cure.

other.text: Recently a health survey was carried out in Taiwan to determine _________.
According to the survey, most Taiwanese believe that _________.
Sullivan, while surveying a campground, felt that a cloud was 24 him, and tried all he could to run— but it got him anyway.
Moran’s watercolors—the first color renderings of the area—as well as Jackson’s photos and the survey results were presented to the Congress.
The survey concludes that younger Taiwanese have a better understanding of health concerns than their parents, while senior citizens have the least understanding among the three age groups.
The results of the survey show that _________.

definition.zh_def: 調查；問卷，通常用於收集意見或數據。
definition.en_def: A method of gathering information or opinions from a group of people, often through questionnaires.
definition.example: We conducted a survey to understand customer satisfaction.
